question_title: Have you ever seen an angel? [SEP] question_content: If so what did it look like? [SEP] best_answer: --------------------------
WARNING! WARNING! WARNING!
--------------------------

Yes, I have. However, your question is dangerous. Satan loves to disguise himself with any form found most comfortable. Even, "an angel of light":

2CORINTHIANS 11:14 And no marvel; for Satan himself is transformed into an angel of light.

For this reason, you can not judge an angel by his appearance. Only the Holy Spirit knows which angels are loyal to Him, and which are rebellious. Only those washed by the blood of Christ can be baptized with the Holy Spirt. Only those who believe in their heart, and confess with their mouth that Jesus Christ is the Son of God come in the flesh as a man can be cleansed with the blood of Christ.

Also, no matter how many angels anyone has seen, we do not put our faith in them, as they did not die for us. We keep our faith in Christ:

COLOSSIANS 3:17 And whatsoever ye do in word or deed, [do] all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God and the Father by him.

Do not worship angels, for Christ is the only God:

EXODUS 34:14 For thou shalt worship no other god: for the LORD, whose name [is] Jealous, [is] a jealous God:

question_title: Why are there more male atheists than female atheists? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: 1st off people who argue over wether men or women are smarter are stupid. there are many forms of intelligence and men and women(biologically) tend to think differently. therefore both genders bring differnt aspects of intelligence to the table.

 i am a male atheist and people who suggest that most people who are athiest are victims of "God couldnt have let this happened to me, therfore there is not a God." are very incorrect. I was raised christian and i became atheist because i simply consider religion too lacking in the facts department and therefore does not satasify my need to have proof before i belive in something. some people like to think that we have souls and that there is more to life then actually life. but i belive that this is our only life and we possess no soul. i came through the conclusions through solid logic and reasoning and am still trying to find the whole truth of the situation.

as for why there are more men then women athiest(no one can really say since they are only one person and not the whole athiest community...) but i think it is because men are raised to be strong and independent(which leads to independent thinking) while females are raised to be friendly, kind, giving, and somewhat reliant on others(either emotionally or in some cases finacially). therefore, i think women tend to accept religion better then men because our society suggests that relying on someone or something such as religion for emotional support is more acceptable for women than it is for men, and to me emotional support seems to be the main reason for following a religion (even if it is just to lower the anxiety of death)

question_title: How do I burn a PowerPoint presentation w/ audio from a music CD to a disc? [SEP] question_content: My wife (a teacher) made a PowerPoint 'slideshow' for graduation, it works with an audio CD for background music. She wants to put it on a CD or DVD; the music needs to be continuous between slides (i.e. 1st song starts w/ slide 1, song 2 starts at whatever slide song 1 ends at, etc.)\n\nWe also have the songs as MP3 files. Is there an easy way to link to them and put them in a folder to record on a CD, or to embed them? I see how we can link to an MP3 for a single slide, but not to one that will run over as many slides as it takes, and then to have the next song start right away. [SEP] best_answer: You might consider using windows movie maker.  If you save the slides as pictures you can import them into movie maker, add music and have your own slide show with music in the background (you can also do effects like fades between slides). You can them put the final video on DVD or cd.  Hope that helps, let me know if you have any more questions.

question_title: How do you set up two computer monitors on one computer? [SEP] question_content: If any one knows how to do it PLEASE ANSWER! [SEP] best_answer: You need two video cards installed, if you have a regular desktop machine.  For laptops/notebooks with an external display port, you can hook up a second monitor to the port, and use both that and the notebook monitor (you will have to make a change to your graphic settings, depending on your installed video card).\n\nFor a desktop, install a second video card.  Open Display in the Control Panel, and click the monitor icon for the monitor you want to use in addition to the primary monitor.  Select Extend My Windows Desktop onto this Monitor checkbox, then Apply, then Ok.  If you don't see that checkbox, your card may not support multiple monitors.  Make sure you have hardware that supports multiple monitors before you purchase any equipment.  You might wind up having to buy to video cards (one to replace your original card, and one to support the additional monitor.).

question_title: Shell Script to check if another instance of Java App is running? [SEP] question_content: I want to know how from Unix Shell Script I can check if another instance of a java program is running. [SEP] best_answer: Historically, the "ps" command read the argv[] array from
each process to determine its invocation arguments.
However, each process could alter these argument strings
and thus "lie" to administrators and other users as to which
process was running (as well as which arguments were being
used).

To counter this, SysV kernels copy (the first 80 bytes of)
the command invocation into a save area in the process
table, and *that* is what "ps" uses.   This is why you're
only seeing the first 80 characters of the command.  On the
bright side, you know the data is accurate; on the down
side, you only see 80 bytes worth.

To solve your problem with the long command, you can step
back and use the old mechanism.  You could fall prey to
someone "spoofing" the command line; however, for normal
processes, you'll be able to see the entire invocation.

On Solaris, the old version of "ps" is in /usr/ucb/ps and
you should invoke it with the "-auwwx" option.  The "w"
option means "wide".  A single "-w" goes to 132 characters,
but if you specify *two* "w"'s, then it will print as many
characters as it finds in the argv[] array.  Thus use:

/usr/ucb/ps -auwwx | grep MyJavaProg

If you're using a different Unix, the path might be
different, but you might look for either alternate
versions of "ps" or special options which extract
the information from the process rather than the
kernel.

An alternative to get the same information is to use the
/proc utilities.  For example, on newer releases of
Solaris, the command:

/usr/bin/pargs <some_process_id>

will print the command line arguments **taken from the
process itself** (not the kernel).  So you could scan all
processes via:

cd /proc
for i in * ; do
/usr/bin/pargs $i
done

Note, however, that you will NOT be able to inspect
other user's processes this way unless you have
sufficient privilege (ie. execute as "root").  Presumably
other UNIXes (and Linux) provide similar /proc utilities,
so the syntax might vary, but the concept should be
the same.

question_title: VB.NET code to store the primary key in a datagrid when edit button is pressed? [SEP] question_content: I have a data grid on a web application.  My grid fills up fine and I have a delete  button that is part of the gird.  When it is pressed it deletes the select row and everything is fine.  But once I add a second button to the data grid I get an error.  When I try to click either button.  So the delete button now wont work. I use   PID = Integer.Parse(e.Item.Cells(1).Text) to store the primary key field.  This works fine with the delete button alone but I want to use the same code line in the editcommand so i can store the Primary Key for later use but when I have 2 buttons attached to my form it give me an error on that line.  I just need to store the primary key in that row.  Like I said I works great with only one button on the data gird but when there are two buttons it will not work.  What can I do? [SEP] best_answer: I'm not exactly clear on what you're trying to do with the second button, but if you're binding the datagrid from a query, you should be able to set the DataKeyField property of the datagrid to the primary key of your query.  It will then automatically be stored for each row when the datagrid is bound.

You can then retrieve it by using a line like:

            Dim PID As Integer = Val(source.datakeys(e.Item.ItemIndex))

If this doesn't help, contact me with the exact error message you're receiving and with more info about what you are using the second button for, and I'll try to help.

- Rich
http://www.IMAgolfer.com

question_title: what is ethnography and what is its significant in design? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethnography\n\nEthnography (from the Greek ethnos = nation and graphein = writing) refers to the qualitative description of human social phenomena, based on fieldwork. Ethnography is a holistic research method founded in the idea that a system's properties cannot necessarily be accurately understood independently of each other. The genre has both formal and historical connections to travel writing and colonial office reports. Several academic traditions, in particular the constructivist and relativist paradigms, claim ethnography as a valid research method.

question_title: What is the difference between the different operating systems? [SEP] question_content: esp. windows home, media center, and pro.
Can you change operating systems after you get a computer with one pre-installed? [SEP] best_answer: there is really no different

Windows home it is for peple who just want the basics but still stay up to date

WIndows Professional is more techinical it is for business and people who want more than the basics

Windows Media Center is the same as Windows pro it just has software named Windows Media center in it and it has better processors video cards sounds cards and motherboards

You can have your change to a differrent Os (Operating System)
but you might have get and new and better motherboard and processor - This is if you change it from windows home to pro

If you want to change from window home or pro to media center you WILL need to change your motherboard, processor , video card, and sound card to new one close to top of the line plus if you want a keyboard for media center it will cost over $100 for one that is not wireless

if you dont get these change your computer will be very slow

If a site doesn't have this file it will show the IE icon instead.

question_title: What is the daily schedule(rise to bed) of a software professional working in United States? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: It depends on what field you're in and how much experience you have.  I have about 10 years of experience and I work in a software development shop developing software for retail businesses.  I get up at 6 AM, take the kid to school by 7:30 and work from around 7:30 (school is VERY close to work) until around 5PM.  I do Aikido (martial arts) twice during the work week for a couple of hours.  The rest of the time I'm spending time with my family or studying to be a better developer.

Many younger coders and those in the game development business work a LOT more hours.  Years ago I worked 50, 60 or even 70 hours a week.  That was too much time away from the family, so I worked myself into a better position.

To finish answering your question, I'm usually in bed by 11PM.

Your issue is on messenger. You contacts are logging in and out.

question_title: we have to program our PC card for data acqusition using VB6.we want to know PCI interface with VB6.? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: It depends on what software interface the driver for the data aquisition card provides. If it is COM based which it probably is, you should be able to interface with VB6. But If you are writing a driver for the PCI card yourself, you cannot do that in VB. You will need to develop that driver in C and compile against the DDK (driver development kit). Also, know that VB6 is no longer supported by Microsoft. You should look into newer technologies such as .NET.

question_title: about hp lap top... the touch pad tap isnt working. i have to press the button under the touch pad. broken? [SEP] best_answer: Check your device manager to see if its listed under "mice and other pointing devices".  It should say something like, "Synaptics PS/2 Port TouchPad" or something similiar.  If you don't see it there, RIGHT click and scan for hardware changes.  You may need to perform a system recovery.  Otherwise, go to Best Buy and get a wireless USB mouse.  It's what I use for my laptop, works great.

question_title: MacAfee- uninstall? [SEP] question_content: I have MacAfee on my system but I can't remove all of its components. I tried re-installing and uninstalling but I can't get it off my system.
How can I permantly remove all aspects of this software from my system? [SEP] best_answer: Sometimes the add/remove programs doesn't delete it all.  You could have remnants of files (called orphan files) left behind.

1. Select Start -> Search -> All files and folders
2. Type in "mcafee" without the quotes
3. In the drop down menu select My Computer
4. Under Advanced Options, make sure you check mark the first three items: Search hidden files and folders; Search system folders; Search subfolders
5. Run the search (it could take several minutes)
6. Highlight and then delete any file or folder found by the search
7. Reboot.  You should be good to go.

question_title: when I sign on I get an error message System 32 and a Trojan Virus message. How do I get rid of it? [SEP] question_content: I have a program that I need to delete I guess.  When I tourn on my computer I get a message that says "error running application"  System 32.  Then it shows Trunk 32dlg.exe has encountered a problem.  
When I check ok the box disappears and I get a Trojan Virus alert and it fixes the problem but it still comes back each time I turn on my computer.
I have been also told that Norton Anti Virus can slow down a computer with all the anti things it has on it.  Can someone please help a dumbass:-)  Thanks [SEP] best_answer: As a security consultant by trade, I've seen your situation countless times.  Your computer is infested with some sort of malware (virus, trojan, spyware, etc...).  Here's what I'd suggest you do, this works almost every time:

1.  Uninstall any antivirus software on your computer.  Reason:  the malware may have damaged it.  If you have a favorite antivirus program you can always reinstall it later.

2.  Go to http://www.grisoft.com.  Download the FREE version of AVG antivirus, install it, update it, and scan your entire computer.

3.  Go to http://www.safer-networking.org.  Download, install, update, and run Spybot32.

4.  Go to http://www.lavasoftusa.com.  Download, install, update, and run the free version of Ad-Aware.

5.  Re-scan using the above three tools until your system is clean.

Good luck, and hope this helps!

question_title: what is the formula or test that can determine if a computer is inteligent? [SEP] question_content: theres some sort of test or somthin that u can do to determine if a computer program is intelligent or not. its called the truant test or somthing to that effect but i cant seem to find it so if someone could give me some info on that then  that would be great. thanks. [SEP] best_answer: A Turing Test (called after its inventor, Alan Turing), does not test a machine's intelligence, but it does test a machine's capability to conduct conversation in a way that cannot be distingushed from a converation with a real human. The test is conducted in the following way: A human judge is presented with a chat screen, in which he talks with two other chatters - one is a human, and the other s a computer. If the judge cannot state reliably who of the chatters is a computer and who is a human, then the computer passes the test. 

It is arguable whether a computer that passes a Turing test is really "intelligent", or is able to "think", for several reasons.

For more details, see the wikipedia article on Turing Test:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Turing_test

To create an MS-DOS startup disk
The MS-DOS startup disk you create will allow you to boot into MS-DOS.

Insert a floppy disk into your computer's floppy drive. 
Open My Computer, and then click the floppy disk drive to select it. 
On the File menu, point to the name of the floppy drive, and then click Format. 
Under Format options, click Create an MS-DOS startup disk. 
Click Start

question_title: what to do for severe backache? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: It depends on whether it's muscular or disc related.

For muscular: sleep flat on your back on a firm surface with your legs bent. Do excercises to strengthen your abdominals. Weak abs are a primary culprit in back strain. Use proper body mechanics. Not too much lifting, and when you do, bend your knees and keep the load close to you. Remember, prevention is easier than cure.

Disc: See a chiropractor, they'll feel it out. Then, see an orthopedic surgeon. Get their advice before doing careful stretching, inversion therapy, and yoga, if you can handle it. Here again, prevention is easier than cure. Try yoga, and eat lots of fiber.

question_title: Can Vitamins make me fat if I'm not dieting and exercizing when taking them? [SEP] question_content: I recently bought some vitamins to take when I started running again but I have not yet started to run. this is my first time buying vitamins and supplements and I was wondering If I can take them even if I haven't yet started to exercize on a daily basis but I'm afraid that I'll put in weight because the bottle says its a dietary supplement. I know nothing about vitamins and I would aprecciate some HELP thanks! [SEP] best_answer: I love how people will make fun of other people when it's most likely the first girl who's insecure about having a fat face. You look like a model in your picture. Not fat at all.Anway, I don't know what you are thinking the term "dietary supplement" to mean as I have heard this question before! The term "dietary supplement" means a product (other than tobacco) intended to supplement the diet that contains one or more dietary ingredients (vitamins, herbs). A dietary supplement is limited to products that are intended for ingestion in tablet, capsule, powder, softgel, gelcap, and liquid form, that are not represented as conventional food or as the sole item of a meal or of the diet, and that are labeled as dietary supplements. Additionally, dietary supplements do not include products that are approved drugs, certified antibiotics, or licensed biologics. Vitamins are intended to help your body function in its optimal state. You should be taking them whether or not you are excersing. They will help in so many ways depending on what you are taking. A good multivitamin for a girl is a hair, skin, and nails formula. You will get alot of vitamins plus ones to help your hair, skin, and nails look their best (very strong, clear, etc). If you take too much hyaluronic acid (you probably aren't taking any however) you can look a little puffy. But that's only if you're taking way more than it says since this product works with water. Don't worry about gaining weight or looking puffy though with normal everyday vitamins. If you have anything out of the ordinary with your health, consult your doctor first. If you are healthy you can probably just take them and not worry about anything. Don't take too much zinc though, I've seen a lot of nausea reported cases.

question_title: How has Bi-Polar disease effected your relationship with friends and family? [SEP] question_content: I have this disease and was wondering, compared to myself. My family is in a different country so we chat daily by phone.The kids usually get shielded by visiting my husbands family, or aunts, uncles, and cousins (something they love to do) in a neighboring town. With neighbors and the cleaning lady, if asked we say I'm not feeling well, but don't go into details. I have only a few friends and they all knoz about my condition, so I tell them and they understand, offering to come over to keep me company, or offering to give me my space. My husband has to be the hardest hit because he has the huge responsibility of working, taking care of everyday things, and on top of it all, he has to take care of me. He is great though and I am lucky to have him in my life.

question_title: What is the Natural cure for hypertension or high blood pressure without using drugs? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Remove your cause of mental tension or stress or worries. If the reason is your office, discuss the problem with your colleagues and seniors. Don't keep the problem with you. Mental tensions can often be reduced by a brisk walk, laugh loudly and relaxation or meditation. In fact, if you daily practice meditation, you can control your blood pressure for ever.
Maintain your weight. Exercise more often. Since excess body fat is a primary risk factor in hypertension, it is important to maintain a healthy weight.
Be physically active. Brisk walking, bicycling, raking leaves, and gardening are the best exercises.
Follow a low fat diet. Eliminate cholesterol in your diet.
Eliminate salt from your diet. Look at the salt content of tinned foods, snacks, potato chips, French fries, diet soft drinks, sauces, etc. These are high in salt, don't eat them. Do not eat foods that contain soda, sodium, Na, monosodium glutamate, baking soda and preservatives. Read the food labels carefully. With herbs, spices, garlic and onions, you can make your food tasty without salt.
Restrict consumption of refined sugars. Read the lables and note different names of sugars.
A high fiber diet is recommended.
Increase intake of potassium, magnesium, calcium and vitamin C. Potassium rich foods include banana, orange, tangerine, beans, dried peas,potatoes, etc.
Magnesium rich foods include almonds, cashews, pecans, rice, banana, potatoes, kidney beans, oat bran, peas, soy, wheat germ, etc.
Calcium rich foods include low fat dairy foods, nuts, watercress, kale, broccoli, turnip greens, collard greens, mustard greens, etc.
Garlic helps reduce blood pressure and cholesterol.

question_title: I want to know more on impotence due to diabetis? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: In men

      Long-term diabetes can cause damage to the nervous system, which is involved in the complex process of erection.

      This means men with diabetes may suffer from erectile dysfunction (ED) and be unable to get or maintain an erection. As many as a third of men with diabetes experience ED.

      
      Term watch
      Erectile dysfunction is another name for impotence.
      Some men only discover they have diabetes when they seek treatment for their erectile dysfunction.

      Once diabetes has been regulated through diet, pills or insulin injections, sexual problems usually disappear and the ability to get an erection is restored.

      In women

      A number of women with diabetes may suffer from recurring vaginitis (inflammation of the vagina), which is usually due to yeast infection. This makes sex painful. You may suffer itching or burning sensations.

      Women with diabetes may also get recurring cystitis.

      There is also some suggestion that women with diabetes have problems with arousal, and just as the penis fails to become erect in the man, the clitoris in a woman may not respond to stimulation in the normal way.

Can you make your sex life work when you have diabetes?

If you feel diabetes is causing problems with your sex life, talk to your doctor.

While no-one relishes talking about sexual problems with a doctor, these issues can only be addressed if you seek help.

Your doctor will try to find out whether sexual problems are caused by defects in the nervous or circulatory system as a result of the diabetes, or whether they are of a more psychological nature. Often this distinction is difficult to make.

In any case, when sexual dysfunction begins to happen on a regular basis it tends to get worse unless it is properly treated, so the psychological element inevitably builds up.

An increasing number of men who have diabetes and ED are being helped by medicines such as sildenafil (Viagra), tadalafil (Cialis) and vardenafil (Levitra).

If tests confirm that your nervous system hasn't been damaged by diabetes, and there are no associated circulatory problems, there's no reason why your sex life shouldn't recover.

Sometimes a little help and support from your partner and doctor is all that's needed.

What can be done about sexual problems that are not caused by diabetes?

This is a sensitive issue, but help is available.

Generally the most useful first port of call is your family doctor, who can refer you (and your partner) to a psychosexual therapist - or marriage guidance counsellor if this is more appropriate.

Try not to dwell on the fact diabetes can cause sexual problems - just because it can, doesn't mean it will.

And if you do experience difficulties, be reassured that nowadays there is a lot of help available.

question_title: Why should I drink a lot of water before blood drawn? [SEP] question_content: I need this information to be added into my chemo diary, and published soon.  Anyone that answer the question are highly appreciated. [SEP] best_answer: As far as a blood test determining triglyceride levels is concerned, for 12 to 14 hours before the test, only water is permitted.

Overnight fasting is essential for an accurate measurement of blood triglycerides!

In addition, alcohol should not be consumed for the 24 hours just before the test.

You are also not supposed to take any vitamin supplements 24 hours prior to your fasting blood work. If you are currently on antihistamines, antibiotics or cortisone treatment only, you need to call the lab or your doctor for more information on how to proceed.

Anything taken in, other than water, during that time can elevate the blood triglycerides as they change dramatically in response to meals. Without the proper fasting, they can easily be high enough to prompt your doctor to prescribe drugs.

However, even fasting levels may vary considerably day to day. Therefore modest changes in fasting triglycerides measured on different days are not considered to be abnormal.

(Note:  Researchers from Saint Louis University School of Medicine, Missouri have found that high triglycerides block leptin - a hormone secreted by our fat cells - from getting into the brain by impairing its transportation system (Diabetes, 2004: May).

As a result, leptin cannot do its work in turning off feeding and burning calories.

In other words, high triglycerides make the brain "think" the body is starving so we keep eating and... gaining weight. This is probably one of the reasons why so many people are becoming obese.

By lowering triglycerides then, we could help the body's own leptin to work better so we could get skinnier avoiding heart problems, cancer and diabetes - common chronic diseases linked to obesity.)

I'm so sorry for your mother
when a cancer has reached a site far from the original site (i mean when there is no direct contact between the two sites) it's then called a distant metastasis and in oncology classifications it's known as M1 in TNM classification and grade IV in WHO classification
in such cases the treatment is very difficult because this means that the cancer cells have managed to escape from the original site and escape from the protective mechanisms circulating in the blood and present in different tissues to reach another distant site
No one can say how long would a patient with metastatic bone cancer live and it's dependent on many factors one of them is what type of bone cancer
In most cases the treatment such a patient will recieve is to help her continue her life without suffering or pain

question_title: My wife wont stop washing her hands, help? [SEP] question_content: MY WIFE HAS A PRABLEM WITH WASHING HER HANDS LIKE EVERY FIVE MINUTES... SHE WASHES THEM SO MUCH THAT HER HANDS AND RISTS ARE RED AND SOMETIMES EVEN BLEED .... WHAT CAN I DO TO HELP HER STOP? [SEP] best_answer: I agree with the others that it sounds like your wife has OCD.  I pasted some info. below, and there is more if you go to the website.  Encourage your wife to speak to her doctor about this; he/she can give her a referral to a psychiatrist.  If your wife is resistant to the idea, show her this info., or the info. on the website; maybe that will convince her.  Good luck.


Typical Compulsions
Compulsions are repetitive, often ritualized behaviors that are intended to suppress the anxiety caused by obsessions. Compulsions common in OCD are the following:

    * Asking for assurances
    * Avoiding places or situations
    * Cleaning
    * Counting
    * Doing certain tasks slowly and deliberately
    * Doubting and checking, e.g., locks, lights, and ovens
    * Hoarding possessions
    * Ordering or arranging
    * Repeating behaviors, including speech and action
    * Washing, e.g., excessive hand-washing or bathing 

Typical Obsessions
Obsessions are recurrent, intrusive, and unwanted thoughts, impulses, or images that cause significant anxiety. At first the obsession may be experienced as relatively benign. Over time, the person associates it with fear and disabling anxiety. Obsessions fall into the following common thematic categories:

    * Fear of contamination with dirt, germs, or poisons
    * Fear of having a serious illness
    * Fear that ones actions hurt other people or cause bad things to happen
    * Inability to discard useless items (hoarding)
    * Inappropriate sexual and aggressive thoughts and images
    * Need for symmetry, order, or exactness

question_title: how did bird flu start and where did it start from? [SEP] question_content: the efects of bird flu on man are they dangarous? [SEP] best_answer: While prior H5N1 strains have been known, they were significantly different from the current H5N1 strain on a genetic level, making the global spread of this new strain unprecedented. The current H5N1 strain is a fast-mutating, highly pathogenic avian influenza virus (HPAI) found in multiple bird species.

Countries that have reported one or more major H5N1 outbreaks in birds (causing at least thousands but in some cases millions of dead birds) are (in order of first outbreak occurrence): Korea, Vietnam, Japan, Thailand, Cambodia, Laos, Indonesia, China, Malaysia, Russia, Kazakhstan, Mongolia, Turkey, Romania, Croatia, Ukraine, Cyprus, Iraq, Nigeria, Egypt, India, France, Niger, Bosnia, Azerbaijan, Albania, Cameroon, Myanmar, Afghanistan, Israel, Pakistan, Jordan, Burkina Faso, Germany, Sudan. H5N1 has been found in birds in the wild in numerous other countries: Austria, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Denmark, Greece, Hungary, Iran, Italy, Kuwait, Poland, Serbia and Montenegro, Slovakia, Slovenia, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom. Countries with massive bird die offs that do not confirm H5N1 include: Ethiopia.

Bird flu is any flu caused by a virus adapted to birds.

It is also called avian flu, avian influenza and bird influenza.

The only known such viruses are Influenza A viruses. All subtypes (but not all strains of all subtypes) of this species are adapted to birds, so for many purposes avian flu virus is Influenza A virus (the "A" does not stand for "avian").

However most people use "avian flu" to mean H5N1 which is the subtype of the species Influenza A virus that is the world's major flu pandemic threat.

So "avian flu", "bird flu", "avian influenza", and "bird influenza" all mean the same thing; but are all used to mean these very different things:

    * flu:
          o flu from Influenza A viruses which are adapted to birds (the technically correct meaning)
          o the flu acquired from any Influenza A viruses
          o the H5N1 flu (flu acquired from H5N1)
    * virus:
          o Influenza A viruses which are adapted to birds
          o the Influenza A viruses
          o the H5N1 subtype of the Influenza A virus.

question_title: Running or Cycling? URGENT? [SEP] question_content: Which one is better and burn more calories? I'm 5'1" and 106lbs, and I need to lose 10lbs more. [SEP] best_answer: Running burns more calories. If you can combine running for 10 mins consistently then do 50 lunges, run for 10 miuntes do 50 squat jumps, run for 10 mins do 50 push ups, run for 10 minutes up/down a flight of stairs, find a hill then do 10 sprints up and down, then 10 mins consistently. 

Variation is also the best thing to do. It means you are placing less strain on the same muscle groups and stimulating other muscles. 

If you want to do this it is for life so you need to totally change your way of eating and exercising. This is not a diet rather than a healthy eating plan for life. So no more talking diet cause it means time limit. 

Here are the golden rules: 
Initially cut down to 1200 calories. 
Exercise 6 times per week for 1 hours a day. Do three weight sessions and three cardio sessions. No gym involved. 
Don't eat carbs after 4pm, never eat carbs within 2 hours of exercise or within 1 hour of exercise. 
Drink 3 litres of water per day. You can have a green tea at the end of the day. 
Limit your fruit in take to 2 pieces per day. 
Never eat dinner after 6pm.
Adopt of low GI eating plan this is sustainable for life!
Make low fat dairy choices 

Follow this menu plan as a suggestion: 
Breakfast 7am - 1 cup hot water w lemon
20 minutes later have a bowel of oats w water (no honey) OR
fruit salad w low GI soy yogurt
Snack 10am - pear or apple (both low GI)
Lunch 12.30pm - muligrain sandwich w 50g tuna & salad (no butter)
Snack 3pm - low GI yogurt OR skim berry smoothie (no honey or banana) plenty of ice, 1/2 cup skim milk & 1/4 cup yogurt

question_title: what is the best solution or treatment for a trigger finger? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: If your symptoms are mild, simply resting the finger may be enough to relieve the problem. Over-the-counter medications such as Tylenol® or Advil® can be used for pain. Splints are sometimes used to rest the finger. Your doctor may recommend an injection that helps in most cases, but sometimes the improvement is temporary. More than one injection may be needed. Injections are less likely to bring about permanent relief when the triggering has been present for a long time, or if you have associated medical problems like diabetes. If the problem remains troubling, you may want to consider surgery.

question_title: How do you get over fear of the dark at the age of 24??? [SEP] question_content: I'm embarrassed to even write this because it makes me sound so pathetic. I have a LOT of fears and suffer from depression, anxiety and panic attacks, for which I'm on medication and under the care of a psychiatrist.

One of my main fears seems to be a fear of the dark. I haven't always been scared of the dark, this has only been over the past year or two and seems to be getting worse. I get really panicky when it's dark - I have to have a baby's night light in my room at night or I have a panic attack as soon as I put the light off. But there are other situations which can be embarrassing - the other night I was watching TV with my flatmate and he put the light off......I managed to cope OK until he switched off the TV and we were plunged into darkness, then I got really panicky and it was embarrassing to say the least.

How can I get over this? I feel like such a baby! [SEP] best_answer: well firstly and most importantly stop feeling embarassed... i am 27 and afraid of the dark since i was a little girl... so? what? since it's not something that you have since childhood probably your generalised anxiety triggered it as well as other fears and phobias too. so feeling embarassed just makes you feel more anxious and therefore intesifies your fear of dark. leave a small light on in your room (like a baby's night light) and try one step at the time. For example try not to lock your door once or twice a week. Admit to your flatmates you are afraid of dark. When you ll do that you will find out they are afraid of other things too or maybe that they even share the fear of darkness. This will allow you to be less anxious and them being more considerate. Over the years I have realised that you have to manage your fears like climbing. Rule number one: admit the mountian is high! Rule number 2: never look at the top. Always focus on the little step you take. You ll reach the top before you know it...

question_title: What can you say: Biopsy will only spread the bad cell.In this case for breast.? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I have worked in mammography for over 15 years.  If you have a suspicious area in your breast, you must have a biopsy.  It can mean such a difference in your life, and your quality of life.  Biopsies will not spread breast cancer.  Read below, and check out the sources.

"With some types of tumors, such as tumors of the ovary or pancreas, it is possible for a needle to carry a malignant cell to another area.  But this is not a concern in breast cancer. Breast cancer cells do not seem to be able to live independently unless they are biochemically ready to do so. This means that a core biopsy - or any other type of
biopsy procedure - will not spread the cancer to other areas."

http://www.susanlovemd.org/faq/biopsy/biopsy_3.html

Biopsies and/or air cannot cause breast cancer to spread. The fear of biopsies comes from the concern that sticking a needle into a breast tumor to get a sample, or using a scalpel to remove the whole tumor, can then move some of those cells to a different place in the breast (by the cells sticking to the needle or by the cells dropping from the tumor into other places). Studies have not found this to be true for breast cancer biopsies. Some people believe that exposing the cancer to air during surgery or biopsy can cause the cancer to spread -- this too, is not true.

http://www.oncolink.upenn.edu/types/article.cfm?c=3&s=5&ss=38&id=9530

question_title: Prior to the other question about my "issues"? [SEP] question_content: I have a really heavy flow and instead of having my period every month, i skip one or even two. I'm looking for something that can control i.e a birth control pill that isn't strong. [SEP] best_answer: There are tablets which you can take which aren't hormone based but which help to decrease the flow and the pain.

Mefenamic Acid is an anti-prostaglandin (prostaglandins cause the pain during your period) and you take it for a few days before your period is due and for the first couple of days of your period. It help reduce the pain, and also over time reduces the amount of blood loss.

Tranexamic acid is an anti-fibrinolytic and is used to reduce blood flow. 

Both tranexamic acid and mefenamic acid can be used together to reduce blood flow during a period. However, the best thing really is to go onto the birth control pill - it dramatically reduces bleeding and pain.

Also, since your periods are irregular, it may be worth speaking to your doctor about having blood tests done, or possibly an ultrasound to see whether you may have something like PCOS.

question_title: Do you go to dentist or oral surgeon to remove your wisdom teeth? [SEP] question_content: My girlfriend has to go remove her wisdom teeth, she already made appt with the dentist but some of her friends told her that she should go to oral surgeon to get the wisdom teeth removed. They said oral surgeon is specialized on wisdom teeth and because there is nerve on the lower jaw, if the dentist don't do it right she might loose feeling on her cheek and tongue permanently... Now she is very scared. Can any one give me some professional advice? Also how many people had went to dentist and how many people went to oral surgeon to get this done, any problem afterward? Thank you so much in advance! [SEP] best_answer: I am a dentist.

An oral surgeon (properly known as an "oral and maxillofacial surgeon") undergoes 4 to 6 years of training beyond dental school.  Those who spend 6 years typically spend 2 of those 6 years earning an "M.D." degree, and thus hold the titles of "D.D.S., M.D." or "D.M.D., M.D."

Of those 4 to 6 years, oral surgeons get a great deal of experience performing surgery both inside and outside of the mouth.  Third molar (i.e. wisdom tooth) extractions are but a small component of an oral surgeon's training.  Additionally, oral surgeons spend a minimum of 4 months learning anesthesia, and thus are permitted to perform sedations.  General dentists can train to perform sedations, however, most do not.

Extraction of third molars does not require an oral surgery residency, but it does require proper training.  As a general dentist, I extract the vast majority of third molars because I have proper training and experience doing them.  I only refer patients to oral surgeons when they specifically request sedation, or if the case is "high risk" for a nerve injury.  I do this for liability reasons, not because I think the oral surgeon is much less likely to cause a nerve injury.  To be honest, I'd rather have the oral surgeon get sued.

It really depends on the dentist.  Most dentists don't have the proper training extracting third molars, and thus refer patients to oral surgeons.

question_title: Where can I purchase a yoga dvd specifically designed for people with MS? [SEP] question_content: Looking for dvd yoga providers in UK [SEP] best_answer: On Amazon.com there's a DVD available called "Yoga for MS,"
starring Shoosh Lettick Crotzer. It's $29.50.

Also, here's an article on yogajournal.com that may be of some help:

Yoga for Multiple Sclerosis

I have multiple sclerosis and have been practicing Iyengar yoga for a few months. It's been very beneficial. Is there anything I can focus on to bring more progress? 

By Baxter Bell

— Jessica Howland, Kihei, Hawaii 

Baxter Bell's reply:
 Jessica, your entry into hatha yoga with the Iyengar method was a fortuitous choice. The ability to adapt the poses with props can be particularly beneficial with multiple sclerosis (MS), since flare-ups can affect strength, balance, and coordination. 
It’s also important for you to know about a very unique Iyengar teacher, Eric Small (located in the Los Angeles area), whose personal story of developing MS in his late teens and reclaiming his health through his study with Mr. Iyengar is almost legendary. His experience eventually led him to work with the National MS Society to create a yoga teacher-training program for teachers who want to work with students with MS. I was fortunate enough to participate in this course in 2001 with Eric as the lead instructor. 

Studying with an MS-trained instructor can improve your chances of moving through the practice at an appropriate pace for whatever stage of the MS cycle you may find yourself in. In addition, you will learn specific sequences designed for challenges such as fatigue, constipation, problems with digestion, lack of mental clarity, or balance. Balance, for example, can be addressed with asanas such as Tadasana (Mountain Pose), Virabhadrasana I (Warrior Pose I) and Virabhadrasana II (Warrior Pose II), and Trikonasana (Triangle Pose). 

For a student with MS, there are three types of symptoms that hatha yoga directly addresses: fatigue and heat intolerance, numbness in the limbs and loss of coordination, and loss of flexibility and balance. Fatigue and heat intolerance appear to be the most limiting factors to MS students. To counter these limitations, students learn to master the breath and practice restorative postures. Both techniques cool the body and calm the nervous system. The simple breathing technique of lengthening the exhalation a little longer than the inhalation helps quiet the nervous system. It’s been observed that heat, stress, and tension can cause temporary worsening of MS symptoms, so keep the pace of practice relaxed but focused—keeping the body just shy of sweating is important. 

MS can also result in a daily battle with numbness of the arms and legs, muscle spasms, and loss of coordination. The system of yoga emphasizes stretching and breathing, which can release tension and improve circulation and body awareness. Yoga practice can also facilitate harmony between the muscular and nervous systems of the body, possibly resulting in more fluid movement and relief from muscle tension. As a student’s level of body awareness improves, she can begin to recognize the first signs of stress on her system before it overwhelms her. 

Finally, in addition to evolving body awareness, yoga increases flexibility and balance. The poses increase the range of motion in the joints and improve muscle tone, and work of most of the body’s muscle groups. 

Your yoga practice can be tailored according to your needs. If you are in a period of remission and your balance is intact, you can often do most of poses practiced in an ordinary class setting. During periods of relapse, stay in the groove of practicing by doing a modified practice, for example lying supine on the floor or utilizing chairs and the wall. 

The effect of hatha yoga on MS is of such great interest that the National Institutes of Health’s National Center for Complementary and Alternative Medicine division has funded a study of the effects of yoga on MS patients. Preliminary data shows improvement speci

question_title: Invisalign or traditional braces? [SEP] question_content: Which is better and why? [SEP] best_answer: I have invisalign and they are correcting some pretty severe problems that I have had.  The most important thing is not which one you have, but which orthodontist you go to.  You see, most of the work done by invisalign is done by a computer and then approved/disapproved by the doctor.  Some dentists DDS. (not orthodontists) get certified to do invisalign because the company does all the work for them.  They just collect the money.  So, if there were a problem, the only person that could answer up would be someone who isn't an experienced orthodontist.  SO make sure you get a QUALIFIED orthodontist to do the work.  They will know what is possible and what isn't.  By the way, invisalign is only about 1K more than traditional.

question_title: What are the drawbacks to getting Invisalign? [SEP] question_content: I'm considering Invisalign.  I've also looked into traditional braces (I had them about 20 years ago and don't want a metal mouth again).  Does anyone have any endorsements or cautions about Invisalign? [SEP] best_answer: I really don't know of any drawbacks to invisalign.  They are clear mouth trays that you wear all of the time, except when you are eating.  They are very hard to detect, you can hardly see them.  They seem to be a little more expensive then the traditional braces.  At our office they run about five thousand dollars, in which some insurances will cover about half of that.  The only drawback that I can think of would be lack of patient compliance.  IF you don't wear them the prescribed amount of time, then the dentist/orthodontist can't guarantee that your teeth will move the way they are suppose to.  With traditional brackets and bands they are cemented on to your teeth, thus you have to wear them.  Invsisalign is trays you can take in and out, so if you are not wearing them then you are going to waste your money.  I understand they take a little getting use to when you are talking, but this goes away in no time.  I don't know if anyone noticed, but a few years ago tom cruise wore them.  Good luck.

question_title: how to lose weight? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Moderation in all things.  Adjust your diet eliminating "whites" like white potatoes, white bread, white pasta.  Go for fresh veggies and fruits and lean proteins.  Follow a good 1200-1400 diet and you can lose as much as 2-3 lbs. a week with moderate exercise!  Walking 4 times a day for 10 minutes each time will give you more benefit (higher metabolism) than one long walk.  It's a matter of changing your habits.  No soda, no fast foods.  Look up "exchange diet", or "sugar busters" they are both excellent moderate diets.  Godloveya.

question_title: what are the types of dyskinesia? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Dyskinesia is a medical condition meaning the person afflicted makes bad or abnormal movements. Dyskinesia is sometimes caused by long-term use of anti-psychotic drugs or other dopamine antagonists like the antiemetic metoclopramide. The effect of these drugs can be tardive, meaning the dyskinesia continues or appears even after the drugs are no longer taken (see Tardive dyskinesia). Can be caused by uneven transplants in Parkinson's disease.

question_title: I need help finding an advocate to help me with my son at school. He has an I.E.P..not getting proper help .? [SEP] question_content: My son has learning disabilities and is just being shoved in a classroom with the L.D. teacher. he has a higher I.Q. than the kids in the class that he was placed. I need an advocate to help me to understand what the High school is supposed to be doing. I am in Ohio. My son is a good athlete and needs to be eligible. The L.D. teacher is the head football coach. This is why he was placed in his room...at his request. My son said that he feels like he is back in grade school.
I'm told that I could have an advocate to come with me to have a meeting with the counselor and teachers...so that I am getting the right help for my son. [SEP] best_answer: Please be aware that your son may be requiring some remediation activities that are making him feel self-conscious because he knows that the skills are usually addressed at a much earlier grade level. However, without those skills, he will not be able to make academic progress.  You should talk with the LD teacher and (courteously) ask about his reasoning for the work he is giving your son.

If you are not satisfied by the LD teacher's explanation for the work, then call a new IEP. Demand that the committee outline the research-based practices that will be used to remediate your son's deficits (Orton or other LD-specific programming, a "mix" from different LD approaches is fine, as long as they are compatable). 

Try these links:
http://www.reedmartin.com/specialeducationresources.htm
http://www.ocecd.org/ocecd/about/trainers.cfm
http://www.education-a-must.com/aalistnz.html

question_title: what's the different between-ACCUPLACER-TSI-THEA-ACT or SAT test? [SEP] question_content: What's the different between all these test: ACCUPLACER, THEA, TSI, SAT and CAT test? i know that in Texas they have this two test called THEA and TSI. unless there's more that i dont know of. i really didnt do much research, but i am going in tomorrow and speak with the conselor. i need to get a guideline for Radiologist Technician. there's so many question. anyways, thanks in advance for all you reply. [SEP] best_answer: They're all Ability to Benefit tests that schools use to gauge their applicants' scholastic aptitude (and/or their readiness for higher education).\n\nThe SAT is probably the most widely-used of the ones you mention -- most schools will take it and many schools won't take anything else, which is why so many students go this route first.  Your school will determine which tests they accept and might be able to give you recommendations as to which one(s) they prefer.  You probably won't want to go take a test before knowing that they accept it.

question_title: You find them all in a tennis court. What are they? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: The riddle actually goes:

"We're five little items of an everyday sort.
You'll find us all in a tennis court."

The answer is:

Vowels.  A, E, I, O, U.  There are exactly five vowels in "a tennis court", and the term is fairly unique in the fact that all five vowels not only appear only once each, but also in alphabetical order.

question_title: i don't understand quadratic polynomials for algebra 1? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Quadratic polynomials are usually in the form ax^2 + bx + c. They are usually factorable (which means you can find it's simplified roots). These roots should look like (x-F) and (x-G) where F and G are numbers so that when multiplied together using FOIL (First Outside Inside Last), you get your original polynomial. The roots are also where the polynomial = 0, assuming you've set it to zero. If the polynomials do not factor nicely, then you have to use this formula:

-b +/- root(b^2-4ac)
--------------------
      2a


Which will give you the roots. Sometimes you get imaginary roots where in the equation above you will be taking the root of a negative number.

Hope that helps.

question_title: what kind of environments do preschool teachers work in? [SEP] question_content: the physical environment or location (where he/she carroes out his/her duties) [SEP] best_answer: Teaching preschool can be very stressfull.  The number of students depends of the state requirements.  For 4 year olds it's usually 10 kids to 1 adult.  Most classrooms have up to 20 kids with one qualified teacher and an aide.  Depending on how the teacher runs the classroom, determines how loud and stressfull it is.  There needs to be a daily lesson plan as well as a behavior plan with individual goals for the children depending on their needs.  A well organized, experienced teacher can make a world of difference.

question_title: What is a series of five books called? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Both Pentalogy and Quintalogy...

A pentalogy is a series of five related works of art, a lesser-known relative of the words trilogy (three) and tetralogy (four). It is made up of the Greek words πεντε (pente: five) and λόγος (logos: word, story).

A pentalogy has also been called a "quintology", basing the prefix on Latin quinque- instead of Greek.

Hope that helps............cheers

question_title: I want to study inJapan free of charge. Have I chance? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Japan would love to have you!  If you're in college, see your study abroad office for home-stay and study abroad opportunities.  Most are the same cost a semester's tuition, though there are scholarships you can apply for.  If you've already graduated, look into teaching positions (like the JET Program) so you can study in Japan during your free (non-teaching) time. I would say know that I found out that differences between men and me could be softened with the use of my brains and that I am grateful they educated me.

I would say that lying is the worst thing you can do to your family and friends because of the pain that you can cause and because you can lose someone's trust when it's the most precious thing in a relationship.
Then, I would say that I love them and that I'm very happy to be still alive to be able to tell them later all the great adventures I lived.

question_title: how were bic products introduced to consumers? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I remember about 1963, when I was working in an office supply, first seeing the Bic pen. It came in as a cheap (and blotchy) substitue for the Fisher stick pen which was our best selling office pen at the time.

I don't know about now, but back then if you put one in your pocket upside down, the ink would run out.

(edit)
I just read in Uncle John's Bathroom Reader that it was first introduced, by Marcel Bich, in 1958. The US name was changed to Bic so that wouldn't be pronounced to rhyme with itch. His name is pronounced bick. It took a massive advertising campaign to start making it popular in the early '60's, the time I started seeing it.

question_title: What are some great poetry lessons for fifth grade? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: When I taught fifth grade, one of my favorite activities to kick off a poetry unit (or just use as a lesson in the unit) was called a "Find a Poem" workshop.  I checked out many poetry books from the library and gathered those from my personal collection.  Then I had each student pick a partner.  The pairs worked to find poems with certain characteristics, which I had outlined on a worksheet.  The page said:

FIND A POEM 

1. Find a poem that makes you happy.

2. Find a poem that makes you sad.

3.  Find a poem in which rhyme is an essential element.

4.  Find a poem in which rhythm is an essential element.

5.  Find a poem that makes you say, "hmmmmmm."


The pairs were to look through the books, finding each one from a different source (it is fun to watch the books fly around as they are swapped, traded, and explored).  They recorded the title of the book, the name of the poem, and the page number under each.  When the class was finished, we would go around the room sharing a selected favorite of each pair.

The activity is fun and gets them excited about exploring poems.  They also have to identify the difference between rhyme and rhythm in poetry.  The class gets to laugh over funny poems (which are usually the top choices when they are ready to share) and, as a teacher, it is always interesting to see what they choose for the last poem.

I hope this helps as you start your plans - it's a fun activity!

p.s. Something else fun to have the children work toward during your poetry unit would be a "Poetry Cafe."  Have each student memorize one or two favorite poems and share them in a poetry cafe event.  You could invite parents, have them bring treats, and set up the room with tables, a black backdrop and spotlight for the students, and a stool for them to sit on while sharing their poems.  Oh yes, and the audience would not clap...they would snap, of course!  :o)

question_title: Discuss how a business's pricing strategy will differ at each stage of its product life cycle? First assume th [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: That depends...you see in the first stage, Introduction, a business could charge a higher than usual price in an attempt to recoup whatever costs it took to get to the market or a low-to-more reasonable price to gain a larger portion of market share before the next phase of the product lifecycle begins.
The second stage, Growth, is where we begin to see overall costs decrease and sales improve rapidly. 
The third stage is the Maturity stage and here competetive pricing emerges because of the presence of competitors.  This is tied more closely to perceived value for the cost of the product.
The final stage is the Decline stage. Sales and prices began to decrease and profitability slows or diminishes.

question_title: China and Taiwan's relationship? [SEP] question_content: needs to be 150 words exactly [SEP] best_answer: From the beginning of the twentieth century, Taiwan has been separate from China.  First, as Formosa, it was a colony of Japan.  After WWII, Taiwan was liberated from the Japanese, and four years later China's nationalist government was defeated by the Communists.  They fled to Taiwan and established their government-in-exile in Taipei.  Still today, Taiwan's official name is The Republic of China.  Taiwan's government favors eventual reunification with China, on the condition that China is a democratic nation.\n\nTaiwan views itself as independent from Beijing's sovereignty, and most countries support this reality.  Taiwan is not recognized as a sovereign nation in the UN because of China's "One-China Policy", which states that any nation wanting trade and political relations with China cannot openly support Taiwanese independence.  China views Taiwan as a "renegade province."

question_title: what effect does global warming have on the earth? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Global warming is an effect in the earth's lower atmosphere that is claimed to exist by many scientists today.  Essentially, the theory claims that carbon monoxide, fluorocarbons and other gases have damaged the ozone layer, the protective layer in the earth's upper atmosphere that protects the planet from the Sun's ultraviolet (UV) radiation.  Some man-made causes of these gases are automobile emissions and bovine flattulance.  The supposed increased levels of UV radition are striking the earth in greater incidence, especially in the equatorial oceans. Hence, according to the theory, the warming oceans are changing weather patterns and melting the polar ice caps.   More severe storms and raising of the ocean levels are possible.  Detractors of the theory contend, however, that evidence for diminishment of the ozone layer, warming of the oceans and melting of the polar ice caps is scant due to the lack of longitudinal (long-term) climatological data for the earth.  In sum, it is unclear whether the changing weather patterns that appear to be happening are caused by man-made activities or part of some cycle governed by normal processes.

question_title: how does geseous exchange happen inthe lungs and body tissues? [SEP] question_content: how does partial pressures of each gas determine its movement ? [SEP] best_answer: Nitrogen and oxygen make up around 99% of the total atm pressure. Carbon dioxide, water and other inert gases make up the other 1%. There is a graph called the Oxygen-Hemoglobin dissociation curve, and temp. carbon dioxide and blood pH can shift this curve to the left or right...increase in CO2 the curve shifts right, decrease it shifts left. So in tissues the CO2 levels are higher so the Red Blood Cells pick up CO2 easily and in the lungs the CO2 levels are lower than in the blood and O2 is picked up, and of course there is the Cl shift that occurs. CO2 is a byproduct of cellular respiration...energy production in the mitochondria...this is a long question to answer, there is more to it but I hope this helps.

question_title: what is the y intercept of this line? [SEP] question_content: 1. 5x-2y =10 
2. 2y+7x =14
3. x=3
4. 1/2x-2y=8
            Please explain how you found one of them. Thanks! [SEP] best_answer: Where x = 0, the line intercepts the y-axis:

1. 5x-2y =10 
2y = 5x - 10
y = (5/2)x - 5 
y-int = (0, -5)

2. 2y+7x =14
2y = -7x + 14
y = (-7/2)x + 7
y-int = (0, 7)

3. x=3
Has no y-intercept

4. 1/2x-2y=8
2y = (1/2)x - 8
y = (1/4)x - 4
y-int = (0, -4)

question_title: what was the datewhen the cold war ended i really need to know?????!!!!!? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: "Cold War" is an informal expression that, by its definition, does not refer to a period of armed conflict.  Therefore, there is no clear date on which it ended.  Historians typically choose dates that "seem best" to them in terms of saying when the period of US-Soviet confrontation came to an end.  Was it when Solidarity won Polish elections?  Was it when the Berlin Wall came down?  When the Romanians executed their dictator?  When the USSR became the CIS?  Some other event?  Those are dates you can find online, with a little effort.  Deciding which one was when the Cold War ended is going to be up to you.

question_title: Why does the toilet flush backward in the southern hemisphere? [SEP] question_content: I've heard of the toilet flushing backward in the south hemisphere, but I don't know why. Why?

No offense to those down there. [SEP] best_answer: I would like to say thanks to the Coriolis effect, toilets flush clockwise in the northern hemisphere and counterclockwise in the southern.  But it is not true.
The twisting effect of the Coriolis force is real and does influence certain large things like the movement of air masses, but the effect is so small that it plays no role in determining the direction in which water rotates as it exits from a draining sink or toilet. The Coriolis effect produces a measurable effect over huge distances and long periods of time, neither of which applies to your bathroom. Toilets and sinks drain in the directions they do because of the way water is directed into them or pulled from them. If water enters in a swirling motion (as it does when a toilet is flushed, for example), the water will exit in that same swirling pattern; as well, most basins have irregular surfaces and are not perfectly level, factors which influence the direction in which water spirals down their drains. The configuration of taps and drains is responsible for the direction of spin given to water draining from sinks and bathtubs to a degree that overwhelms the slight influence of the Coriolis force.

question_title: Can anyone help me with a persuasive speech on the Philippines? [SEP] question_content: It was suggested we give a persuasive speech on something we're passionate about. I am passionate about the Philippines. I'm stuck on how I can make a persuasive speech about that.

I don't want to persuade people to GO to the Philippines, because I know not everyone can afford to ($ and time). I was thinking of more inspiring/persuading people to just CONSIDER the Philippines as a place to see/visit/experience.

Some good points I have so far as to why people should consider visiting the Philippines are:
1) Friendly people
2) Food's delicious
3) English is spoken by a good majority

Is this an OK topic for a persuasive speech? Should I focus on a particular place in the Philippines? The time for this speech is 5-7 mins. I want to avoid "hot" topics (abortion, gay marriage, stem cell, gun control, etc.) and wanted something more fun/light.

I am sticking with this topic. I would like suggestions on how to make it more 'persuasive' or at least entertaining. Thanks! [SEP] best_answer: It may be said that the Filipinos are intelligent, with retentive memory, quick perception, and talents for art and science. They also are gentle, friend]y, and cheerful people, noted for their courtesy and hospitality.

Filipinos are famous not only for their warm hospitality, but also for their close family ties. The parents work hard and sacrifice much for their children; in return, the children love and respect them and take good care of them in their old age.

Filipinos owing to their beautiful country, are passionately romantic. They are ardent in love as they are fierce in battle. They are born poets, musicians and artists.

Filipinos are a liberty-loving and brave people. They valiantly resisted the Spanish, American and Japanese invaders of their native land. They rank among the bravest people of the world. Filipino courage has been proven in the Battle of Mactan (1521), in the Battle of Tirad Pass (1899), in the battle of Bataan, Corregidor, Bessang Pass during World War II, and in many other battlefields.

Gratitude is another sterling trait of the Filipinos. They are grateful to those who have granted them favors or who are good to them. Their high sense of gratitude is expressed in the phrase Utang na loob (debt of honor).

Filipinos are cooperative. They value the virtue of helping each other and other people. They cherish the ancestral trait of bayanihan, which means cooperation. In rural areas, when a man is building, repairing or transferring a house to another place, the neighbors come to help him.

Foreign writers assert that the Filipinos are indolent. In reality they work hard in the face of very adverse conditions. They work on the farms from sunrise to sunset, though not from noon to 3 p.m. due to the scorching heat. They work hard in the sugarcane and pineapple plantations in Hawaii, the fruit orchards of California, the fish canneries of Alaska, and in the oil wells of Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, and other Arab countries of the Middle East.

Finally, the Filipinos are noted for their durability and resiliency. Through the ages they have met all kinds of calamities--revolts, revolutions, wars, earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, typhoons and epidemics. Unlike the Polynesians of Oceania and the Indians of North Central and South Americas, they did not vanish by contact with the white race. They can assimilate any civilization and thrive in any climate. Against the adversities of life or nature, they merely bend, but never break. They possess the formidable durability of the narra tree and the resiliency of the bamboo.

question_title: Is 180,000 dollars too much to attend Columbia Law School? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Columbia is an EXCELLENT school.  You will likely earn $100 - 125 k your first year out, and you can start paying back your loans quickly.  Also, since it is such a highly ranked school, it will be easier for you to get paid summer internships, which may help offset the costs a bit.

Many law schools have very pricey tuition - I go to Loyola Law, and they are about $32k a year, plus they expect another $15k or so living expenses.  USC is about $40k a year, with similar living expenses.  Unless you go to a state school where you are a resident, or you can find a place with cheap living expenses, you are going to end up with about the same amount of debt no matter where you go. (As to the person who suggested USF - they are actually almost as much as Columbia, and much lower ranked, so you would actually lose money because your salary would be lower coming out!)

Suck it up and take out the loans... you may be eating ramen and mac and cheese for three years, but you will have an excellent legal education and will be able to demand some of the highest salaries once you graduate!!

question_title: Anyone know how residency works for public schools (college)? [SEP] question_content: I'm looking at public univerities and I wanted to know how residency works in terms of out of state/in state rates. I have close family in both Michigan and Illinois and I plan on applying to University of Michigan- Ann Arbor and University of Illinois- Urbana Champaign. But can I claim I residency with either of those family members after a year of attending the school? If I go to any of those two schools I'd plan on spending my time away from school at their houses, not coming all the way back to the East coast.

The reason I'm asking is obvious as it would save tons of money, but I'm sure that there are strict barriers behind it. 

Can anyone explain to me how it works? Thanks a lot in advance. [SEP] best_answer: Every state is different, hope this helps:

Students who reside in Michigan and intend to keep their permanent home in Michigan, not only while in attendance at the University but indefinitely thereafter as well, are considered domiciled in Michigan. If a student moves from Michigan during the period of enrollment, his/her in-state classification is maintained as long as enrollment is continued. If the family of a dependent student moves from Michigan during the time he/she is a student, his/her in-state classification is maintained as long as he/she continues to be enrolled on a regular school-year basis. Since normally students come to the state for the primary or sole purpose of attending the University rather than to establish a domicile in Michigan, those who enroll as nonresidents shall continue to be so classified throughout their attendance as students, unless and until they demonstrate that their previous domicile has been abandoned and a Michigan domicile established.
A married person is considered to be an individual independent of his/her spouse.

ILLINOIS:
http://www.usp.uillinois.edu/residency/residentreg.html


Good luck!

question_title: what structure anchors a mold to its food source? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: This mass of tangled fibres is called a mycelium. The thin strands are called hyphae (singular: hypha). The growing tips of these hyphae are the most active in feeding - they are called feeding hyphae (!!!).\nThe mycelium is often not visible because the hyphae are very narrow and they mostly run through the thing they are feeding on (their substrate).

question_title: Good riddles? [SEP] question_content: Who is the swift one that found me on the road? Neither the sun nor any other light shines on him. I have often seen him running alongside ships at sea. He needs no clothing or food, and is visible to all but tangible by none? 

What has roots as nobody sees, is taller than trees, up, up it goes, and yet never grows? 

Thirty white horses on a red hill, first they champ, then they stamp, then they stand still. 

Voiceless it cries, wingless flutters, toothless bites, mouthless mutters.

An eye in a blue face saw an eye in a green face. “That eye is like to this eye,” said the first eye, “But in a low place, not in a high place.” 

It cannot be seen, cannot be felt, cannot be heard, cannot be smelt. It lies behind stars and under hills, and empty holes it fills. It comes first and follows after, ends life, kills laughter. 

A box without hinges, key, or lid, yet golden treasure inside is hid. [SEP] best_answer: 1. Shadow
2. Mountain
3. Teeth
4. Wind
5. Sun and a daisy
6. Darkness
7. Egg

question_title: how do you study for an important exam? [SEP] question_content: I am cramming for an exam that is in two days and i don't if cramming will help. I have started to study for eight hours a day but i need help... [SEP] best_answer: Here's what you do.  This is exactly what you have to do, so pay close attention:

1) Figure out every possible thing that might be on the exam.  

2) Figure out the exact way the questions are going to be asked.

3) Figure out what the A students and grad students are focusing on.

Then, of course, get the answers.  Make sure you can remember them.

If you don't know these things like they're second nature, you're not ready for an exam.  If you need help, get it.

Stressing out and cramming might help a little, but you're much better off using your head.

question_title: what is difference between e-commerce tools and web programming technology and what is exact mean for e-comm? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Buzz words.

E-commerce tools is a vague description of something that would be used to allow electronic purchasing. By electronic purchasing I mean having a catalog or similar presentation on a web site that buyers can browse and choose products or services from and make a payment electronically through a payment gateway such as a credit card processing company.

Web programming technology is another buzz phrase. It could mean anything. It really depends on the usage in a sentence, and who is using it.

As a computer programmer myself, I would think it means various languages used to create software that is used for web communication and presentation, such as a CGI script that might do a database lookup and produce a results page, like search engine. (CGI stands for Common Gateway Interface).

It's concept is basically some method of transferring information from web server to user's web browser (a somewhat crude definition) or vice-versa. 

To others it may mean a premade software package that can assist a nonprogrammer in producing programs. It's all a matter of usage and the user of the term.

question_title: Aquarius and Libra, do we make a good pair? [SEP] question_content: And i know all we have to do is work hard on the relationship yada yada yada, but i just want to know for some fun! [SEP] best_answer: When Libra and Aquarius join in a love match, their relationship can serve to heighten and strengthen both Signs' consciousness. These two connect on a high mental level; they share a love of art, people and culture; they both abhor restrictive influences in their lives. They are likely to get along well because they have such similar needs and will not require more of one another than they're both willing to give. Both Signs are also very energetic, enthusiastic types; this relationship is not likely to become stagnant. Both Aquarius and Libra are concerned with the betterment of the world and their fellow people. Aquarius is the most progressive thinker of the Zodiac, and they always have a new idea in the works. Libra is the diplomat of the Zodiac; abhorring conflict of any sort, they are born balancers (hence their Symbol, the Scales). Libra's urge to avoid conflict put together with a love of intellectual freedom can lead them to be somewhat indecisive at times; when this happens, more decisive Aquarius can step in and help Libra figure out which direction to turn. Libra can return the favor by smoothing Aquarius's occasionally ruffled feathers that result from the Water Bearer's idealistic thinking sometimes crashing down in the face of reality. Libra is ruled by the Planet Venus (Love) and Aquarius is ruled by the Planets Uranus (Rebellion) and Saturn (Karma). This combination of influences can be an interesting and productive one; Libra and Aquarius should certainly take on other projects together than simply their love relationship, because they can make great things happen using their hearts, their urge for progress and their consciousness of the greater good. These two are an extraordinary duo for standing up for social justice or radical change in the community. Both Libra and Aquarius are Air Signs. They have strong intellectual bonds to one another and constantly stimulate one another's ideas and communication styles and skills. Again, their ability to work together makes it obvious that these two Signs must take on larger projects in their life together -- they should concern themselves with the greater good. Libra can bring a certain balance to any undertaking that almost no other Sign is able to achieve. Aquarius and Libra together will also have many stimulating intellectual discussions about their interests and pursuits. Libra is a Cardinal Sign and Aquarius is a Fixed Sign. Libra sets things into motion but may have trouble finishing them, which is what makes Aquarius's determined influence so positive: The Water Bearer has a great deal of follow-through and can take Libra's ideas and run with them to the end. These two work especially well together as they tend not to argue about who does what, who takes credit and who works behind the scenes versus out in the spotlight. What's the best aspect of the Libra-Aquarius relationship? Their ability to work together as a team. Together they can learn much more than either Sign would alone. Their accomplishments and love of socializing and new projects make theirs a highly successful relationship. \nBest Wishes and Good Luck :-)

question_title: Blonde joke - cruise special? [SEP] question_content: A blonde walks by a travel agency and notices a sign in the window, "Cruise Special -- $99!" So she goes inside, lays her money on the counter and says, "I'd like the $99 cruise special, please." The agent says, "Yes, ma'am," grabs her, drags her into the back room, ties her into a large inner tube, pulls her out the back door and downhill to the river bank, where he pushes her in and sends her floating down the river. A second blonde comes by a few minutes later, sees the sign, goes inside, lays down her money and asks for the $99 special. She too is tied to an inner tube and sent floating down the river. Drifting into stronger current, she eventually catches up with the first blonde. They float side by side for awhile before the first blonde asks, "Do they serve refreshments on this cruise?" The second blond replies, "They didn't last year." [SEP] best_answer: ROTFL!! XD That was a funny one.
