The doctor considers this for a moment and then says: "Well, let me tell you a story: I know a guy who is an avid hunter.   He never misses a season. But one day, he is in a bit of a hurry and he accidentally grabs his umbrellainstead of his gun.  So, he walks in the woods near a creek and he spots a
beaver in bush in front of him.   He raises up his umbrella, points
it at the beaver and squeezes the handle.   *BAM*, the beaver drops dead in front of him. 
"That's impossible!", says the old man in disbelief Someone else must have shot that beaver!"

question_title: dvd imax movie? [SEP] question_content: What special things i need to buy for watching that kind of movie,and Where is that [SEP] best_answer: IMAX is basically a very huge and I mean HUGE screen at some cinemas. I'm talking 8 stories high complete with wrap-around digital surround sound. I'm afraid its not something you can recreate in your living room! A few film are made just for the IMAX screen and when you watch them on a regular tv set you just know that it was made for the biggest screen in the world (which is what IMAX is.) The Polar Express was made for IMAX. Even watching it on my 52" plasma tv I knew it was made for bigger viewing. Often they do the movies in 3D too. The Cirque Du Soleil made a movie for IMAX called The Journey Of Man. I have it on dvd but oh my how I wish I had the oppoutunity to see it on IMAX!

question_title: if you could only use one sense which would it be? [SEP] question_content: sight, hearing, Taste, touch,or smell?why? [SEP] best_answer: Sight, of course. Without your sight you wouldn't be able to get around yourself or see your children as they grow.

My grandparents are deaf and they get along just fine. They live exactly as I do without having any problems.

Loosing my sense of touch would be very strange, but most likely manageable. I've never actually heard of anyone loosing this sense.

Taste and smell are the same to me. I could easily go without them. I don't particularly like to eat that much and I foresee that as being the biggest problem that would come of losing these two senses.

So, yes, I pick sight. :o)

question_title: wher can I find a site that brings me happiness and hope to countinue my life? [SEP] question_content: I need to be happy and feel beauty of life by going to some exiting places [SEP] best_answer: THe path to beauty and happiness lies within yourself. You don't need to find it anywhere else. 
Let me tell you a story (er, now I have time, so don't mind). Long long time ago, when humans live happily on earth. A horde of devils came down to ruin their lives. They managed to steal happiness from humans, but they didn't know where is the safest place to hide happiness, sothat no human could find. You guess where that place is? It lies safely within yourself. It lies in the way you thought about life.
DO NOT THINK OF ANY EXITING PLACES, 'cause there's no other way than to live on your own.

This reply is a little bit off topic, but I think it can help you. You can try finding a site to feel better, but remember that you're the only one who can make your life more happy.

question_title: What did you think about Lost last night? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: it was sad. if I didn't think they were all dead already and in some form of "waiting room", I'd have felt really bad for the girls who got killed.

See, it's my theory that everyone on the island is dead on earth. However they got to the island, they got there by dying on earth. The ones who appear alive are those who still need some kind of karmic "work" done on them, some self-knowledge to gain, or some penance to work out. Some are just plain low level human scum like the "others" who may have the idea that stealing babies or children will allow them to get off the island through their innocence, maybe they have figured out the after-life thing and they want a vehicle for rebirth, or whatever.

Ana was killed right after she reached a pinnacle in her self-development that she couldn't kill anymore. I am not sure about the other girl, though. Maybe she died at the rehab.

Anyway, I think Michael is either trying to rile them all up against the Others or else he has been black-mailed to do this by the Others or else he has been "Stockholm-syndromed" by the Others.

question_title: Movies, music and books for free? [SEP] question_content: Music, books and movies.  

I constantly see people wanting to get this stuff for free.  

Does everyone consider the real cost of free items?  

If no one purchased an early Rolling Stones album, would they have been able to sustain a career in music and go from their meager beginning to create and perform some of the more enduring songs of their generation.

If no one purchased "Harry Potter and the Sorceror's Stone", would J. K. Rowling, have been able make it to six volumes.  

If everyone who watched "Mean Streets" and "Taxi Driver" did so without benefit of paying for the privilege, would Martin Scorsese have been able to make "Gangs of New York" or " The Aviator".

"Think of your favorite movie, that one that you love with all your heart.  Now, pretend you have never seen it and never will." [SEP] best_answer: you are not looking for an answer, are you?

question_title: three wise men ...? [SEP] question_content: Three men were sitting together bragging about how they had given their
new wives duties. 

The first man had married a woman from Albania, and bragged that he had
told his wife she was going to do all the dishes and house cleaning that needed
done at their   house. 

He said that on the first day he didn't see any difference and
on the second day he didn't see any difference, but on the third day he came home to
a clean house and the dishes were all washed and put away.

The second man had married a woman from Korea. He bragged that he had
given his wife orders that she was to do all the cleaning, dishes, and the
cooking. He told   them that on the first day he didn't see any results and on the second
day he didn't see any results, but on the third day, his house was clean, the dishes
were done, and   he had a huge dinner on the table.

The third man had married a Scottish girl. He boasted that he told her
that her duties were to keep the house cleaned, dishes washed, lawn mowed,
laundry washed   and hot meals on the table for every meal. He said on the first day he
didn't see anything and on the second day he didn't see anything, but by the third
day most of   the swelling had gone down and he could see a little out of his left
eye. [SEP] best_answer: Ha Ha Ha...Bloody Hen pecked Hubby ...got good thrashing in the beginning of the married life?1 Ha Ha Ha nice way of presentation ! Punchline was great and evoking loud laughter !!! LOL !

question_title: Did you hear that Gerald Levert Died Today??? [SEP] question_content: I heard on the radio he died of an heart attack!!! [SEP] best_answer: Gerald Levert (July 13, 1966 - November 10, 2006) was an R&B singer, one of several from the musical Levert family. His father, Eddie Levert, is the lead singer of the 1970s soul group The O'Jays. Gerald Levert sang with his brother, Sean Levert, and Marc Gordon in the R&B trio LeVert. He was also apart of R&B musical group, comprised of legendary R&B artist Keith Sweat, Johnny Gill and himself called LSG.

During the 1980s and early 1990s, LeVert scored big hits with "Pop, Pop, Pop, Pop (Goes My Mind)", "Casanova", and "ABC-123" (not to be confused with the Jackson Five hit of the same name). As a solo artist, Gerald's hits included "I'd Give Anything (to Fall in Love)", "You Got That Love", and "Mr. Too Damn Good to You".

Gerald and Eddie collaborated together on many different occasions, and they recorded an album called Father and Son together.

Gerald Levert also sang the chorus on the Chris Rock spoken-word comedy piece, "No Sex (In the Champagne Room)".

In 2005, Levert's daughter Carlysia was featured on an episode of MTV's My Super Sweet Sixteen.

Levert passed away due to an apparent heart attack on November 10, 2006.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gerald_Levert
